conclusion: Understanding the relationship between light source, objects, and shadows
The light source is positioned in front of the objects
Shadows A, B, C, and D are cast on the ground directly behind the objects
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will shift to the right side of the objects
If the light source moves to the back left, shadows will become smaller because the light source is further away
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will shift to the left side of the objects
If the light source moves to the back right, shadows will also become smaller for the same reason
Moving the light source to the back left will move shadows A, B, C, and D to the right side of the objects
Moving the light source to the back right will move shadows A, B, C, and D to the left side of the objects
In both cases, the shadows will become smaller due to the increased distance between the light source and the objects
When the light source moves to the back left, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the right side and become smaller
When the light source moves to the back right, shadows A, B, C, and D will shift to the left side and become smaller
